tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE employee_activity (
  employee_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  employee_name VARCHAR(50),
  login_time TIMESTAMP,
  logout_time TIMESTAMP,
  activity_description TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE employee_locations (
    location_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    employee_id INT,
    location_name VARCHAR(100),
    location_coordinates VARCHAR(50),
    last_updated TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE RemoteEmployees (
    employee_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    employee_name VARCHAR(50),
    department_name VARCHAR(50),
    remote_login_time TIMESTAMP,
    remote_logout_time TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE ActivityLogs (
    log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    employee_id INT,
    activity_type VARCHAR(50),
    activity_time TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (employee_id) REFERENCES RemoteEmployees(employee_id)
);

CREATE TABLE SecurityAlerts (
    alert_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    log_id INT,
    alert_type VARCHAR(50),
    alert_time TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (log_id) REFERENCES ActivityLogs(log_id)
);

CREATE TABLE remote_employees (
    employee_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    employee_name VARCHAR(255),
    department VARCHAR(255),
    remote_access BOOLEAN,
    login_time TIMESTAMP,
    logout_time TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE activity_logs (
    log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    employee_id INT,
    activity_description TEXT,
    activity_time TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE security_events (
    event_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    employee_id INT,
    event_type VARCHAR(50),
    event_description TEXT,
    event_time TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE device_logs (
    device_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    employee_id INT,
    device_type VARCHAR(50),
    last_connection_time TIMESTAMP,
    online_status BOOLEAN
)

CREATE TABLE employees (
    employee_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    full_name VARCHAR(255),
    email VARCHAR(255),
    department VARCHAR(100),
    position VARCHAR(100),
    hire_date DATE
)

CREATE TABLE employee_login (
    login_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    employee_id INT REFERENCES employees(employee_id),
    login_time TIMESTAMP,
    logout_time TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE employee_activity (
    activity_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    employee_id INT REFERENCES employees(employee_id),
    activity_description TEXT,
    activity_timestamp TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE department (
    department_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    department_name VARCHAR(100),
    manager_id INT REFERENCES employees(employee_id)
)

CREATE TABLE security_logs (
    log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    activity_id INT REFERENCES employee_activity(activity_id),
    log_details TEXT,
    log_timestamp TIMESTAMP
)
